panels.description: This chart shows the average processing time of HTTP requests over the last 5 minutes. It helps monitor server performance and detect any delays in request handling.
panels.title: Average HTTP Request Processing Time

panels.description:
Average message processing time for RabbitMQ listeners per minute.
This metric is useful for analyzing the performance of RabbitMQ listeners. For example, if the average message processing time increases, it may indicate an issue with message handling or an increase in message complexity.
panels.title: Average message processing

panels.description: Visualize the maximum execution time of RabbitMQ message listener methods in Spring Framework. This graph provides insights into the longest duration taken for processing messages, aiding in the identification of potential performance bottlenecks. Monitoring this metric supports the optimization of message listener methods for efficient message processing.
panels.title: Max Execution Time of RabbitMQ Message Listeners

panels.description:
Represents the number of active connections currently in use.
Monitoring the number of active connections helps in understanding the load on the database and identifying if the pool is under-provisioned.
panels.title: Connections Active

panels.description:
Number of idle connections in the pool.
Helps in understanding the pool's capacity and its ability to handle sudden spikes in demand.
panels.title: Connections Idle

panels.description:
Total number of connection timeout occurrences.
Useful for identifying issues where connections cannot be acquired within the configured timeout, indicating potential performance problems.
panels.title: Connections Timeout

panels.description:
Number of connection requests that are currently pending.
Indicates if there is a backlog in connection requests, which can suggest the pool is under heavy load or not adequately sized.
panels.title: Connections Pending
